title: Who were the most important people in Ancient India? - Quora

response.answer_text: Many. 4 billion years ago, it was Brahma, then the four sanat kumaras. Then Saraswati. Then the prajapatis, Kasyapa and Daksha were the two prominent ones among them. Then the 12 adityas, 11 Rudras, 8 Vasus and 2 Ashwins were the most important (these 33 'gods' and all their descendants together were called as the 330,000 gods or 33,000,000 gods or 3,300,000 gods). The most important of the Adityas was one named Vishnu, of all Rudras, was the one named Shiva and of all Vasus, was the one named 'Agni'. Brihaspati and Sukrachaarya were most important with the rise of Indra among these 33 gods. Birth and rise of Vasishta and Agastya also started at this time (all in the previous two sentences were posts also, but these were the firsts).  Then, Prahalada was most important, after whom was Bali. Vaivaswata Manu was the most important after that, followed by Bharata, followed by Prithu, followed by Harischandra. Sagara was the most important human after that, followed by Dileepa. Bhageeratha was the most important human thereafter, followed by Ambareesha. Raghu (Raghu II) was the most important after that followed by Sri Rama.  Yayati, followed by Puru were the most important thereafter. Followed by Bharata (different than one mentioned above) who was most important after that. During this time Vyasa rose who then also became most important. Bheeshma was the most important after that. And he was followed by Yudhistra and Bheema and Arjuna. Pareekshit was most important after that followed by Janameyjaya.  Astika rose to prominence by disrupting Janameyjaya's snake sacrifice (i.e. Aztec's rose to prominence around this time in Americas). Ramses II was most important after that followed by Akhenaten and then Imhotep II (all Egyptians).  The western yadaavaas (judaas, or jews) and yavvanaas rose to prominence around this time. Metusaleh was the most important followed by Noah in the west. Abraham was most important after that followed by Moses. Nandas in eastern India were most prominent after that, followed by Alexander in the Yavvanaas. Chandragupta Maurya and Vishnu Gupta (Chanakya) were most important after that followed by Gautama Siddhaartha (Buddha). Adi Sankarachaarya was most important after that, followed by Vikramaaditya II.  Around this time, many important people rose from all over the world, from Romans, to Christian religion and people to Islam, etc. In India, Arya Bhatta was the most important around this time followed by Varaha Mihira in and Vikramaaditya III in Guptaas and Gautami-putra Satakarni in Deccan plateau. Raja Bhoja was most important after that along with Kaalidasa. Followed by Harshavardhana followed by Bhaaskaraacharya and Kalhana in Kashmir. After them, obviously, we had several islamic kings in India. During this time, Maha Rana Prataap was most important as well as several kings in Orissa and Bengal. Kakatiyaas were most important in Deccan plateau followed by Sri Krishnadeva raya in the south. Followed by Shivaji, followed by the Peshwa Balai Baji rao followed by Madhava rao and Baji rao finally who ruled Delhi before signing it over eventually to the British.

Most important people in ancient India according to historians are:- Bharata- Tribal chief of Bharata clan. Son of Shakuntla and Dushyant. India is known as Bharat because of him. Ajatshatru- He was from Haryak Dynasty and ruled over Maghadh a Mahajanpadas. He led to a war between Magadha and Kosala.Vardhaman Mahavira- Jainism is spreaded all over the continent because of him.Gautam Buddha - Founder of Buddhism. Given the theory of eight fold path.Dhana Nanda - Ruler of Nanda Dynasty. Had big empire.Mahapadma Nanda- famous ruler of Nanda dynasty. He went on to destroy all the Kshatriyas and their kingdoms. According to the Puranas he defeated several kingdoms including the Kurus, Panchalas, Maithilas and the Surasenas.Chandragupta Maurya- Founder of Mauryan Dynasty. Had first time centralized administration.Bindusar- known for the battle that he fought between two sea.Ashoka- Famous ruler of Maurya Dynasty. Known for his Policy of Dhamma.Chandragupta 2- Chandragupta Vikramaditya was one of the most powerful emperors of the Gupta Empire in India. His rule spanned c. 380 – c. 415 CE during which the Gupta Empire reached its peak. Art, architecture, and sculpture flourished, and the cultural development of ancient India achieved new heights.Samudragupta- His rule was one of expansion marked first by the conquest of his immediate neighbours and then by campaigns to the east and the south where chiefdoms and kingdoms were subdued and forced to pay tribute to him.Harshavardhan- The peace and prosperity that prevailed made his court a centre of cosmopolitanism, attracting scholars, artists and religious visitors from far and wide. Known for Prayag assembly.Rudraman- known for repairing of Sudharshan lake. He was a Saka ruler.Gautamiputra Satkarni- The information available about Gautamiputra Satakarni comes from his coins, the Satavahana inscriptions and the royal genealogies in the various Puranas . The best known of these is the Nashik parashasti. inscription of his mother Gautami Balashri, which credits him with extensive military conquests.Narahima varman- was a Tamil king of the Pallava dynasty who ruled South India from 630–668 AD. He shared his father Mahendravarman's love of art and completed the work started by Mahendravarman in Mamallapuram.Pulkesin 2- the most famous ruler of the Chalukya dynasty. During his reign, the Chalukyas of Badami saw their kingdom extend over most of the Deccan.Dantidurga- The Ellora record of Dantidurga narrates that he defeated the Chalukyas in 753 and took the titles Rajadhiraja and Parameshvara. He was from Rashtrakutas Dynasty.Many famous person who wrote and had contributed to society- Kautilya- Chanakya was an Indian teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist and royal advisor. He is traditionally identified as Kauṭilya or Vishnugupta, who authored the ancient Indian political treatise, the Arthashastra.Aryabhatta- Aryabhata or Aryabhata I was the first of the major mathematician-astronomers from the classical age of Indian mathematics and Indian astronomy. His works include the Āryabhaṭīya and the Arya-siddhanta.Patanjali- The Yoga Sūtras of Patañjali are 196 Indian sutras. The Yoga Sutras were compiled prior to 400 CE by Sage Patanjali, taking materials about yoga from older traditions.Kālidāsa - was a Classical Sanskrit writer, widely regarded as the greatest poet and dramatist in the Sanskrit language of India. His plays and poetry are primarily based on the Vedas, the Mahabharata and the Puranas.Bhaskara- was an Indian mathematician and astronomer.Charak- Charaka was one of the principal contributors to Ayurveda, a system of medicine and lifestyle developed in Ancient India. He is famous for authoring the medical treatise, the Charaka Samhita.Vatsayan- Vātsyāyana is the name of an ancient Indian philosopher, whose name appears as the author of the Kama Sutra.Ved Vayas and Valmiki- wrote Mahabharata and Ramayan.Tolkappiyar - Tolkappiyam authored by Tolkappiyar was the earliest work, provides the information on Social, Economic and political conditions of the Sangam Age along with the Tamil grammar.Rajaraja Chola- born Arulmoli Varman, often descibed as Rajaraja the Great, was a Chola emperor of medieval south India chiefly remembered for reinstating the Chola power and ensuring its supremacy in south India and Indian Ocean.Source- wikipedia Edit: Chera, chola, Pandyas, belongs to Ancient period but thecontribution of their kings were not mentioned in a great manner.
